p: An ILI case was defined as a person with sudden onset of fever (>38 °C), and cough or sore throat, in the absence of an alternative cause. SARI cases were defined as subjects aged ≥5 years with sudden onset of fever (>38 °C), any of cough, sore throat, or difficulty breathing, and requiring hospital admission; or children aged <5 years with suspected severe pneumonia and requiring hospitalization [12].
